page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY-LANDSCAPE
page.content: The block is an undulating area to the east of the industrial town of Barrow -in-Furness.The bulk of the block is good quality pasture land with smaller areas of enclosed rough grazing and wet lands.Much of the area is drained by deep drainage ditches which with the help of small streams(becks) drains the land to the sea on the east.The area is lightly populated with four small settlements:Leece, Gleaston,Dendron and Newbiggin,and isolated farm houses.The local stone, carboniferous limestone,and the rocks from the sea form the building materials of the old houses.There is an attractive coastline facing Morecambe Bay whish in summer attracts day visitors from Barrow.The block has very little in the way of amenities or entertainment and people look to Barrow for this.
